abstract: New York Giants defensive tackle Jimmy Kennedy, who is serving a four-game suspension for violating the NFL’s performance-enhancing drug policy, is eager for chance to redeem his name; says he did not test positive for a steroid, but is hesitant to get into specifics about the test.
snippet: Jimmy Kennedy, a defensive tackle for the Giants, was suspended for four games last month for violating the N.F.L.’s performance-enhancing drug policy.
lead_paragraph: Jimmy Kennedy, a defensive tackle for the Giants, was suspended for four games last month for violating the N.F.L.’s performance-enhancing drug policy.

headline.main: Waiting to Play, and to Redeem His Name
headline.print_headline: Waiting to Play, And to Redeem His Name
headline.seo: Waiting to Play, And to Redeem His Name
